channel.title: What are your must-read business books?
channel.description: Looking to add more books to my shelf, preferably ones that'll help me improve my business -management skills. Any suggestions?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: chriskottom
item.description:
I’ve read The E-Myth Revisited and Zero to One during the past six months, and both of them were full of great new ideas. I think the next business books on my list will probably be Work the System and Turning Pro.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: cadbloke
item.description:
Choose Yourself by James Altucher. And plus a billionty for anything Derek Sivers says or writes or does.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: ChrisGraniczny
item.description:
Anything you want by Derek Sivers. Same kind of approach as Basecamp, I love it.

item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: cliffordoravec
item.description:
When you say that you want to improve your business management skills, what areas are you looking to improve and to what end?

I really think that context would help to get some more tailored recommendations from the people here.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: blake
item.description:

item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: Find_70
item.description:
The Art of War, of course is a classic. It may seem antiquated at first, but many of those lessons apply to management today as well.

It’s not specifically business management, but I found: Zero to One to be a great book.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your must-read business books?

item.title: What are your must-read business books?
item.dc:creator: bears
item.description:
In all seriousness:

  1. The Utopia of Rules: On Technology, Stupidity, and the Secret Joys of Bureaucracy. (David Graeber)
  2. On Bullshit (Harry Frankfurt)
  3. Neurotic Styles (David Shapiro)

Read full topic
